availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard C. Yeager (Trimble County, Ky, farmer and blacksmith)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer and blacksmith. Henry County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas W. Yeager and Elizabeth Yeager. Married to Mary F. Ward Yeager in Trimble County on December 25, 1853. Father of John Yeager, William Yeager, Lafayette Yeager, Jacob Yeager, Asher Yeager, and William H. Yeager. Farmer in Trimble County, Kentucky in 1850. Blacksmith in Trimble County in 1860. Blacksmith in Trimble County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, District 1, p. 416A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, Bedford, p. 258.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, Palmyra, p. 236A-236B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages.
Find A Grave, "Richard C. Yeager (1823-1891)," Memorial #81548313, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81548313 (accessed August 26, 2020).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Trimble County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 266 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
